page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: {Kingswinford}in 1985 is a bustling overgrown village on the edge of the West Midlands conurbation. It has many shops but people still visit the larger nearby towns for much of their shopping. It is a pleasant place to live but has its fair share of jobless particularly amongst the young. There are still many signs of former heavy industry in the area affecting the landscape. Brickworks are still in use but coalmining and steelmaking have died out leaving derelict land on which houses are being built. The area does not have many amenities but good entertainment and sport are available close by or on television. The older areas have more amenities than the new housing estates where it is assumed that people have their own cars.
